channel.title: Player chat event?
channel.description:
Might be a very simple thing to deal with, but I just for the life of me can't find the class that handles text in the chatbox. I'm trying to make donators have their own little icon in front of their name when they speak in chat, just like pmods and jmods (chat box, not the text above your head).. so how would I got about doing this?
Sorry if this is the wrong section, quite new to moparscape.

item.title: Player chat event?
item.dc:creator: @Hacking_Rs Hacking Rs
item.description:
@Hacking_Rs wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:4, topic:507432”]Try this: http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/tutorials/415411-667-adding-donator-more-symbols-chat-yell.html[/quote]Download link broken.
Is there no other way to do this? I know RuneScape has some cool looking icons, that I actually use in some of my messages, but how would I go about adding them in the chatbox in front of / next to someones name?

Read full topic

item.title: Player chat event?
item.dc:creator: @Hacking_Rs Hacking Rs
item.description:
@Hacking_Rs wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:2, topic:507432”]Welcome to Mopar, to start.
Also, this is client sided work, as images pertaining to crowns are handled through the client.
Use this: http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/356706-pi-adding-new-player-rights-crowns-pi.html
…assuming you are using Pi.[/quote]I’m actually using ZenithScape source & client, which I’m editing to my needs. (if that made any sense)
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=555776.0

I just can’t find the class from all that mess.
Any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: Player chat event?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Welcome to Mopar, to start.
Also, this is client sided work, as images pertaining to crowns are handled through the client.
Use this: http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/356706-pi-adding-new-player-rights-crowns-pi.html
…assuming you are using Pi.
